title: Motilal Oswal Financial Sevices' new home loan division to cater to women
text: Motilal Oswal Financial Sevices' new home loan division to cater to women By ET Bureau | 3 Jul, 2015, 10.41AM IST ET SPECIAL: Love visual aspect of news? Enjoy this exclusive slideshows treat! MUMBAI: A subsidiary of Motilal Oswal Financial Services has set up an all-women's home loan division that will lend only to women from the low-income group. Mahila Awas Loan from Aspire (MALA), launched by Aspire Home Finance Corporation (AHFCL), will offer loans from Rs 12 lakh to both Rs 2 lakh to salaried and self-employed women for purchase and construction of affordable housing units, the housing finance subsidiary of Motilal Oswal Financial Services said in a press release. The first branch under MALA division has come up in Naigaon, Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR).AHFCL plans to open more such branches in Maharashtra, Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh in a phased manner. Aspire is looking to provide housing loan assistance to 1,000 women customers in the current financial year under MALA programme. "Being a low-and mid-income home finance company with focus only in retail home loans, post a comprehensive research, we decided to bring in a product to cater to low-income women customers," said Anil Sachidanand , MD and CEO of AHFCL . Projects where 70 per cent construction has already been completed will only be considered for affordable housing loans for these women, Sachidanand added.
